indications: terconazole vaginal cream , 0.8 % indicated treatment vulvovaginal candidiasis .
contraindications: recommended dose one applicator full terconazole vaginal cream 0.8 % ( 5 grams cream containing 40 mg terconazole ) administered intravaginally daily bedtime three consecutive days [ patient counseling information ( 17.1 ) ] . terconazole vaginal cream , 0.8 % oral ophthalmic .
warningsAndPrecautions: terconazole vaginal cream 0.8 % supplied 20 gram tubes measured dose applicator . ndc 0168-0347-20 store 20°c 25°c ( 68°f 77°f ) [ usp controlled room temperature ] .
adverseReactions: terconazole vaginal cream , 0.8 % contraindicated patients known hypersensitivity terconazole components cream . information regarding cross-hypersensitivity terconazole azole antifungal agents . monitor patients history hypersensitivity azoles .
indications_original: Terconazole vaginal cream, 0.8% is indicated for the treatment of vulvovaginal candidiasis.
contraindications_original: The recommended dose is one applicator full of terconazole vaginal cream 0.8% (5 grams of cream containing 40 mg terconazole) administered intravaginally once daily at bedtime for three consecutive days [see Patient Counseling Information (17.1)]. Terconazole vaginal cream, 0.8% is not for oral or ophthalmic use.
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Terconazole Vaginal Cream 0.8% is supplied in 20 gram tubes with a measured dose applicator.
                  NDC 0168-0347-20
                  Store at 20°C to 25°C (68°F to 77°F) [see USP Controlled Room Temperature].
adverseReactions_original:
Terconazole vaginal cream, 0.8% is contraindicated in patients with known hypersensitivity to terconazole or to any of the components of the cream.
                  There is no information regarding cross-hypersensitivity between terconazole and other azole antifungal agents. Monitor patients with a history of hypersensitivity to azoles.
